alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Coastal Glynn; Inland Camden; Inland Glynn; Northeastern Charlton; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:21PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Camden, Glynn, eastern Brantley, southeastern Wayne and northeastern Charlton Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 321 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Thalmann to near Waverly to 7 miles east of Homeland. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodbine, Dock Junction, Waverly, Thalmann, Everett, Waynesville, Atkinson, Mount Pleasant, Tarboro and Boys Estate. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Brantley; Coastal Glynn; Inland Camden; Inland Glynn; Northeastern Charlton; Wayne
